posts.name: BoLee
posts.cooked:
I saw that ConsistencyCheck supports distributed in version 7.1.49, so I tried running it. I noticed that it must start a process of class test, otherwise it will not be able to start ConsistencyCheck. When I run the following command, it prompts for successful check.

fdbserver -r consistencycheck --knob_consistency_check_range_begin_0 aaa --knob_consistency_check_range_end_0 iii --knob_consistency_check_range_begin_1 jjj --knob_consistency_check_range_end_1 zzz --logdir .
startingConfiguration: start
Run test:ConsistencyCheck start
setting up test (ConsistencyCheck)...
running test (ConsistencyCheck)...
ConsistencyCheck complete
checking test (ConsistencyCheck)...
fetching metrics (ConsistencyCheck)...
1 test clients passed; 0 test clients failed
Run test:ConsistencyCheck Done.

1 tests passed; 0 tests failed.

But when I checked the log, I didn’t find any ConsistencyCheck_FinishedCheck related fields. And there are also some backtrace.

I tried to decode and found that tool fdbserver.debug reported an error.

addr2line -e fdbserver.debug.x86_64 -p -C -f -i 0x7f4106450630 0x7f410644daa1 0x433ba94 0x433d725 0xdc94d0 0x7f4106095555 0xe2ec12
addr2line: fdbserver.debug.x86_64: File truncated

So how do I determine if it has really been checked? Thanks!
